newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends down as dollar demand up.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends down as dollar demand up.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed lower at 42.8465/8495 to the dollar in interbank trading, compared with the previous close at 42.8380/8480, dealers said.

The taka was quoted at 42.8440/8500 per dollar in early trade. "The big players were short of the U.S. currency as there were heavy demands for payment of oil import bills," said one dealer with a foreign bank.
The interbank call money rates closed firmer at 7.5 percent to 8.5 percent against 7.0-7.75 percent previously, dealers said.
